thread.title: Sister of Melbourne plane crash victim says her 'heart is broken' - 9news.com.au
thread.title_full: Sister of Melbourne plane crash victim says her 'heart is broken' - 9news.com.au

title: Sister of Melbourne plane crash victim says her 'heart is broken' - 9news.com.au
text:
Sister of Melbourne plane crash victim says her 'heart is broken' By 9NEWS 
The sister of one of four Texas golfers who died when an aircraft crashed into a Melbourne shopping centre has paid tribute to her “handsome, athletic big brother”. 
Denelle Wicht said her older brother, Greg De Haven, was “thrilled” about his three week trip around Australia and New Zealand. 
The group’s light plane had just taken off from Essendon Airport around 9am on Tuesday when pilot Max Quartermain made two mayday calls. It then crashed into the rear of DFO Essendon, near the Spotlight and Focus on Furniture shops. 
“He told me about this wonderful trip all set up with all his friends,” Mrs Wicht said during a video interview. 
Mr De Haven, 70, was a former FBI agent and US army veteran who “liked to keep active”. 
“He loved the water, loved being outside, trained for a long time to be in a triathlalon.” 
She said he didn’t like being in the limelight, and was “well-liked, sarcastic, funny and just a really lovely guy”. 
“He was steady. Someone you could always count on.” 
It was one of Mr De Haven’s children who called Ms Wicht to pass on the “surreal” news that her brother was among the five people killed in the crash. 
“My heart is broken. That’s how both my sister and I feel. He was our big brother.” Greg De Haven, 70, was a former FBI agent and US army veteran. (Supplied) 
She said her thoughts were with his wife, Laurie, who is now in the care of the US consulate. 
“It’s really really difficult for all of them and my heart goes out to my dear sister in law and the rest who were all on this trip.” 
Ms Wicht also said Mr De Haven’s death will be “so hard” on his three children, and six grandchildren. 
“They were all together at Christmas time. 
“I’m sure that was a blessing they had that time together before he was gone.” © Nine Digital Pty Ltd 2017
